definition: study hard and every day you will improve (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 hao3 xue2 xi2 , tian1 tian1 xiang4 shang4

sentences.english: Many disaster will happen every day in the world.
sentences.chinese: 在這個世界上，天天都邑發生很多災難性的工作。

sentences.english: Well, Translucency is one of those phenomenon that goes a bit beyond your everyday Lambertian diffuse.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，這些現象是半透明多少超越你天天朗伯漫。

sentences.english: I keep that clear plastic case where I can see it every day.
sentences.chinese: 我一直把那個透明的塑料盒擺在天天能看得到的地方。

sentences.english: So, newscaster, what's the weather like today?
sentences.chinese: 那和，新聞播音員，今天天氣怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Do not go through life; Grow through life.
sentences.chinese: 不求匆匆過人生，只求天天都成長。

sentences.english: But for you, every day I will dream the most beautiful apart.
sentences.chinese: 可是由於有了你，我，天天均可以夢想最絢麗的拜別。

sentences.english: There was a rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and who feasted sumptuously every day.
sentences.chinese: 有一個財主穿著紫色袍和細麻布衣服，天天奢華宴樂。

sentences.english: Fifty human years are equal to one day & night among the Devas of the Four Great Kings.
sentences.chinese: 人間五十年，是四大王天天神的一晝夜。

sentences.english: Don't you feel to be swabbed everyday " acupuncture point " very troublesome?
sentences.chinese: 你不覺得天天擦洗“穴位”很麻煩嗎？

sentences.english: Every morning he gets up very early to work and gets home late.
sentences.chinese: 天天早上他都是很夙起牀往上班，很晚纔回家。

sentences.english: The student should sleep for 9 hours everyday, had better get up early .
sentences.chinese: 學生應該天天睡足9小時，儘量夙起。

sentences.english: my advice is to go there every day,
Mum: It’s a lovely day. Let’s go to the flower show.
sentences.chinese: 今天天氣很好，讓我們去看花展吧。

sentences.english: Our government from both parties Democrat and Repubican fighting each others.
sentences.chinese: 我們的政府，共和和民主黨天天打。

sentences.english: Don't be a prophet of doom. Of course it will be sunny on your wedding day.
sentences.chinese: 不要悲觀，你舉行婚禮那天天當然會放睛的。

definition: lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
